text: The Anglican Diocese of Bunbury is located in the south of Western Australia. The diocese is a part of the Province of Western Australia of the Anglican Church of Australia and a part of the Anglican Communion.http://anglicansonline.org/australia/states/western- australia.htmlhttp://ministryblue.com/anglican-Bunbury.html The diocesan bishop is Ian Coutts, Bishop of Bunbury, who was installed as bishop in November 2018. ==List of Bishops of Bunbury== {| class="wikitable" style="width: 95%;" |- ! colspan="4" style="background-color: #7F1734; color: white;" | Bishops of Bunbury |- ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 10%;" | From ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 10%;" | Until ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 33%;" | Incumbent ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 42%;" | Notes |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1904 | style="text-align: center;" | 1917 | Frederick Goldsmith | Previously Dean of Perth; resigned and returned to England. |- valign="top" style="background- color: #F7F0F2;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1917 | style="text-align: center;" | 1937 | Cecil Wilson | Translated from Melanesia; retired. |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1938 | style="text-align: center;" | 1950 | Leslie Knight | Died in office. |- valign="top" style="background-color: #F7F0F2;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1951 | style="text-align: center;" | 1957 | Donald Redding | Returned to parish ministry. |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1957 | style="text-align: center;" | 1977 | Ralph Hawkins | Also Archdeacon of Perth; retired. |- valign="top" style="background-color: #F7F0F2;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1977 | style="text-align: center;" | 1983 | Stanley Goldsworthy | Previously Archdeacon of Wangaratta; returned to parish ministry. |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1984 | style="text-align: center;" | 2000 | Hamish Jamieson | Translated from Carpentaria. |- valign="top" style="background-color: #F7F0F2;" | style="text- align: center;" | 2000 | style="text-align: center;" | 2010 | David McCall | Translated from Willochra. |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 2010 | style="text-align: center;" | 2017 | Allan Ewing | Previously an assistant bishop in Canberra and Goulburn. |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 2018 | style="text-align: center;" | present | Ian Coutts | |} ==Cathedral== The cathedral church of the dioceses is Saint Boniface Cathedral in Bunbury. The cathedral is of brick construction in a modernist style with a prominent clock tower at the east end crowning the sanctuary. The foundation stone was laid in 1961 and the cathedral was consecrated on 14 October 1962. Prior to 1962, the diocese was based at St Paul's Pro-Cathedral, which was constructed in 1866 on the site of an earlier church. St Paul's, previously only a parish church, had been named a pro-cathedral in 1903 in preparation for Bunbury gaining diocesan status the following year. It was demolished in 1963.St Boniface Anglican Cathedral – Heritage Council of Western Australia. Retrieved 27 May 2016. ==See also== *St Boniface's Church, Bunbury England *Saint Boniface Cathedral, Winnipeg ==References== ==Further reading== * Tredwell, J.J., The Cathedral Church of Saint Boniface, Bunbury, Western Australia, 1972 * Bartlett, Joan, JOURNEY, A History of the Anglican Diocese of Bunbury, Western Australia, 2004, . ==External links== *Diocese of Bunbury website *Bishop's personal website *St John's, Albany Bunbury Bunbury Anglican Parishes Category:1904 establishments in Australia Category:Province of Western Australia
title: Anglican Diocese of Bunbury
